content: As an AI language model, I don't have access to current news, but generally speaking, the French Navy has maintained a military presence in the Mediterranean Sea for decades. France's strategic interests in the region, which include maintaining access to ports and shipping lanes, ensuring the security of its territorial waters, and participating in peacekeeping and counterterrorism operations, have driven its ongoing naval presence in the Mediterranean. This presence has included participation in multinational exercises and operations, as well as independent deployments of French naval assets.
